textBeforeTable: Windows Family Qemu/kvm will likely run most production operating systems, but this page is maintained nonetheless for general information purposes. Updates are welcomed. Note: Guest Support Status 2.8 Others 2.7.3 QNX 2.7.2 Debian GNU/Hurd 2.7.1 Minix 2.7 Other UNIX systems 2.6 UNIX Family: Solaris/OpenSolaris 2.5.8 DragonflyBSD 2.5.7 Darwin 2.5.6 PC-BSD 2.5.5 MirBSD 2.5.4 NetBSD 2.5.3 Debian GNU/kFreeBSD 2.5.2 FreeBSD 2.5.1 OpenBSD 2.5 UNIX Family: BSD 2.4.12 Mikrotik 2.4.11 Crux Linux 2.4.10 Mandriva 2.4.9 Mandrake Linux 2.4.8 Arch Linux 2.4.7 Gentoo 2.4.6 SystemRescueCD 2.4.5 Qemu-Puppy 2.4.4 Slackware 2.4.3 openSUSE 2.4.2 SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 2.4.1 Android
textAfterTable: Windows 2008 Small Business Server 64 qemu-kvm-0.11.0 AMD 64 Works (reboot from guest doesn't correctly work) Installed on 2 GB RAM, 1 CPU core. Host is: Ubuntu Server 9.10 64-bit, 2 x Six-Core AMD Opteron(tm) Processor 2425 HE, 8 x 4 GB DDR2, ISCSI for Guest discspace. Don't use virtio drivers (harddisc/network), use IDE (harddisc) and e1000 (network) emulation instead. By Mark. Windows 2008 Standard 64 qemu-kvm-0.11.0 AMD 64 Works (reboot from guest doesn't correctly work) Installed on 2 GB RAM, 1 CPU core. Host is: Ubuntu Server 9.10 64-bit, 2 x Six-Core AMD Opteron(tm) Processor 2425 HE, 8 x 4 GB DDR2, ISCSI for Guest discspace. Don't use virtio drivers (harddisc/network), use IDE (harddisc) and e1000 (network) emulation instead. By Mark. Windows 2008 Standard 32 qemu-kvm-0.11.0 Intel 32 Works Installed on 1.5 GB RAM, 2 CPU core. Host is: Fedora 14 32-bit, Intel(R) Core(TM)2 CPU 6300 @ 1.86GHz, 3 x 1 GB DDR2 + 1 x 2 GB DDR2, single SATA for host, separate SATA for guest. Working just fine with virtio or Realtek for network. CPU usage near 100% when viewing with KVM console, 14% when viewing through Remmina RDP. Windows 2008 R2 RTM 64
